page.title: 20Unwin's Seeds,Westrope's.
page.content: {J.G. Unwin}started{Unwin Grain}in 1885. They get grain from the farmer and give it straight to the millers. The millers roll and crush and grind the wheat to make flour for our biscuits and breakfast food and bread. They do lots of different tests to the grain to make sure it is good enough. The most important test is the moisture test to make sure it is dry. If it is not it goes mouldy. They get 2,000,000 tonnes of grain a year. They export 5,000,000 tonnes. There are only 12 people employed.{Westrope's {Haulage}has been in business for 50 years. There are 36 people employed in Birdbrook and 19 people employed in Scotland. They do more exporting than importing. They take chemicals to Taiwan. They take jacks from Braintree to Scotland. They move paints, petfood, flowers, plants, cereals.
